qa_pair.question: This unit has 10 circuits.  what does that mean and are 10 circuits enough circuits?
qa_pair.answer: 10 breakers are enough for emergency generator power.  You need to determine which of the circuits in your house are essential during a power outage keeping in mind the output of your generator.  Unless your house has a small power requirement some of your circuits will not be connected to your generator.  You need to do some planning.

rewrite.edit: This product has enough circuits for an emergency but it depends how many you deem emergent in your household in the case of an emergency. If you only have a small amount needed, they will all be used.
determine which of the circuits in your house are essential during a power outage keeping in mind the output of your generator  10 circuits enough circuits
You need to determine which of the circuits in your house are essential during a power outage keeping in mind the output of your generator.

qa_pair.question: This unit has 10 circuits.  what does that mean and are 10 circuits enough circuits?
qa_pair.answer:
10 circuits means there are 10 switches or breakers for energizing whatever outlets or switches on that particular breaker.  Circuits vary house to house with how things are set up in the rooms.  10 circuits should be enough for a moderate sized house again, depending on what you have running on the circuits.  With my set up, I have it set up so I have at least two outlets in each room powered up.  This way I can have lights and outlets to charge items like my cell phone and operate a radio.  I also have the refrigerator and freezers powered up as well as my microwave.  On the double breaker, I have my well pump set up so we have running water during a power outage.

qa_pair.question: This unit has 10 circuits.  what does that mean and are 10 circuits enough circuits?
qa_pair.answer: 10 circuits means there are 10 breakers, each can be hooked up to a breaker in your main box.  I chose the circuits that I would definitely require during a blackout such as my well pump.  Hope this helps!

qa_pair.question: This unit has 10 circuits.  what does that mean and are 10 circuits enough circuits?
qa_pair.answer:
This panel functions alongside your main breaker panel. The connections from the main panel breakers are connected to the bypass switches in this panel so that, when your power fails, you can switch those circuits to the generator.  Ten should be enough for most houses in a power outage since it should last a (hopefully) short amount of time.  Make sure you add up the wattage drawn by each of those 10 circuits so you can get a generator with enough power output to handle the load.  And, remember that motors in things like refrigerators and furnaces draw more current when starting than once they are running.

qa_pair.question: This unit has 10 circuits.  what does that mean and are 10 circuits enough circuits?
qa_pair.answer: One circuit on the transfer switch equals a circuit breaker on your panel. You need to determine what circuits on your panel are critical in an outage. Ten worked for me.

qa_pair.question: i have a 8000 watt troybuilt gen can I use this if not ran at full capacity?
qa_pair.answer: I'm not a pro... but the rated output of a generator is not a constant, rather it is the maximum potential of usable power output.  Therefore the potential is not a limiting factor associated with circuit switches.  The limits are the ampere load of each circuit referenced clearly by the individual circuit breaker capacities.

qa_pair.question: What is the difference between this switch and the lower cost 31410CRK switch which also is a 30 amp, 10 circuit switch?
qa_pair.answer: The difference is in the type of circuit breaker used.  Both are resettable, but the Q310A uses industry standard interchangeable circuit breakers, just like the circuit breakers used in standard electrical panels, the 31410CRK uses a push-button type circuit breaker.

summary: This product is a grill that uses propane only and does not have a natural gas option but can be converted for natural gas. A smoker does not need to be added to the unit as the charcoal side can also function as a smoker using the preferred wood chips. The grill's total width is approximately 70 inches, with the addition of a removable 3 inch handle. The heat sources do not combine because they are completely separate fire boxes and grilling surfaces. The charcoal side has an ash drawer that easily pulls out for cleanup and contains venting below the lid which helps with smoke circulation.

summary: The Waka Waka Solar Lamp is a solar-powered light that allows you to use the sun to charge the device during daylight hours to allow the product to hold that charge and stay on once the sun has set. The product has a small LED light at the top that indicates the rate it is charging that blinks using several flashes to tell you the remaining charge simply by looking at it. When the product loses power, it will cut itself off, then automatically come on by itself when the battery is fully charged. The solar light also has the option to use an external charger such as w wall outlet or car charger. The manufacturers’ website suggests that you leave the product on, and it will stay on its highest setting for about 30 seconds and that the product is intended for once-a-month use for emergency lighting.

qa_pair.question: Is this independent of the pool filter?
qa_pair.answer: Pool is filtered through two filters inside cleaner. If your main pool pump is off nothing goes through it however you can run the pump and the cleaner at the same time but not necessary. Recommend you buy two extra filters.

summary: This product works well with leaves. The power supply is included with this product. The power supply should be close to the pool. Make sure you align the white line on the Robot end of the power cord to the white line on the power supply box or it won't work. The power supply to the tiger shark unit is fully inserted. It is filtered through two filters inside cleaner. If your main pool pump is off, nothing goes through it. However, you can still run the pump. Replacement parts are available. Keep them cleaned after each use and you should get 3 years out of them . The filters will last a long time before they need to be replaced.

qa_pair.question: Does it work for a left handed person?

qa_pair.question: Does it work for a left handed person?
qa_pair.answer: I'm not left handed, but I doubt the safety instructions would sanction the operator standing on the blade side versus the motor side of the device.  If you are comfortable reaching across your body, the power switch is accessible from both the left and right.

qa_pair.question: Does it work for a left handed person?
qa_pair.answer: Yes I would say it would. I have not tried it though. The handle that is used for the forward hand is offset to one side. So if you mount it with the offset the other way I believe it would work fine.

qa_pair.question: Does it work for a left handed person?
qa_pair.answer: I don't think it will matter actually.  Although I am right handed. So.....?  The cutting edge is on the right side of the unit.  The handles are square in the middle with no apparent favor to one side or the other.  I hope this helps somewhat.

qa_pair.question: Does it work for a left handed person?
qa_pair.answer: You can use your left hand at the top to trigger the blade and your right hand on the handle.  I'll be using it today (being somewhat ambidextrous) to see if there are any negatives to that approach.  The blade will always be housed to your right, regardless of how you hold it, but I don't see why that would be much of an issue for a leftie.

qa_pair.question: Does it work for a left handed person?
qa_pair.answer: I would say yes, but start off very slowly, always wear eye protection. I've learned to use my left side quiet efficiently by taking it very slow in the beginning  whereas you will build up confidence!

qa_pair.question: Does it work for a left handed person?
qa_pair.answer: Maybe they didn't have this showing before, but the answer is right in the pics.  Look at http://ecx.images-amazon.com/images/I/51QxtKm7TCL SPACEDOTSPACE .jpg (COPY n PASTE TO ANOTHER WINDOW, remove the " SPACEDOTSPACE ") <<< this link to the 4th image down from the top,  IS RIGHT on the page here in Amazon for the product.  The woman is operating the switch with her south paw (couldn't resist) and has her other paw on the grip handle.  No lefties were harmed in this demonstration.

qa_pair.question: How long does a blade last in hours of use?
qa_pair.answer: It depends on the conditions it is being used. If it is a first time use in soil it is going to have a shorter life. If used in the past in just cutting grass it will last longer. There is a wear indicator on the blade "a hole"

qa_pair.question: How long does a blade last in hours of use?
qa_pair.answer: After edging aprox 280 feet of sidewalk, on both sides Plus 40ft drive way both sides and the walkway to the front porch and a sidewalk arond one  end of house. The blade is worn almost to the theholes that are the point to change the blade. I don't know the time range as it was done in stages, not all in one shot. but the notches are worn off almost to change hole. does good job.  Chas K.

qa_pair.question: How long does a blade last in hours of use?

qa_pair.question: How long does a blade last in hours of use?

qa_pair.question: is the handle length adjustable?
qa_pair.answer: Yes.  There are two lengths.  The two lengths are only about 3 inches apart. qa_pair.question: how well does it edge  curbing along streets and yard ??? DOES IT RIDE THE CURB AREA WITHOUT WOBBELING AND FALLING OFF ???
qa_pair.answer: as long as one of the back wheels and the front one is on a solid surface it isn't a problem.  It is also light compared to a gas edger.

qa_pair.question: how well does it edge  curbing along streets and yard ??? DOES IT RIDE THE CURB AREA WITHOUT WOBBELING AND FALLING OFF ???
qa_pair.answer: It's not too bad.  There is a little metal guide on the edger that rides along the curb that keeps it in-line.  I had some problems with mine the first time I edged my lawn since the sod had overtaken a couple inches of the sidewalk.  I just had to go slower and estimate where the curb was.  Sometimes i estimated badly and other times it was fine :)

qa_pair.question: how well does it edge  curbing along streets and yard ??? DOES IT RIDE THE CURB AREA WITHOUT WOBBELING AND FALLING OFF ???
qa_pair.answer: Quite well, only a little bit of guiding in the side to side direction needed.  I tend to have it ride up on the pavement/curb more than off of it, but I edge very close, right along the edge of the lawn.

qa_pair.question: how well does it edge  curbing along streets and yard ??? DOES IT RIDE THE CURB AREA WITHOUT WOBBELING AND FALLING OFF ???
qa_pair.answer: It would depend to some extent on the shape of the curb and how much of a flat platform it presents.  I have some contoured concrete edging around a big flower bed and have found that edging from the grass side, rather than riding it on the concrete, works better.  Along sidewalks, the edger works fine.

qa_pair.question: how well does it edge  curbing along streets and yard ??? DOES IT RIDE THE CURB AREA WITHOUT WOBBELING AND FALLING OFF ???
qa_pair.answer: It has a metal guide bar that hangs down and goes between the yard and the sidewalk.  I keep just a little bit of sideways pressure on it to keep it against the concrete and it cuts a straight edge every time.

qa_pair.question: how well does it edge  curbing along streets and yard ??? DOES IT RIDE THE CURB AREA WITHOUT WOBBELING AND FALLING OFF ???
qa_pair.answer: It weighs enough that I did not have any problems with yard edging. I did not do the curb.

summary: This product can not easily edge around curves. The blade may hit the concrete near curbs. This guide works to keep it off the sidewalk as long as it is pulled backwards so it doesn't widen the cut. The handle is not reversible so a left handed person will be walking behind the blade side. Be sure to wear goggles for protection. The blade will last longer in grass and shorter in soil. The replacement blades are 7 1/2 inches and are  Black & Decker EB-007 Edger Hog Heavy-Duty Edger brand. This product can make a small 4-5 inch deep trench that is 1 inch wide. The handle length can be adjusted by the 2 knob that will give you an extra 2 inches. The edging feature for this works very well when the back wheels are on a solid surface.

qa_pair.question: the little black knob on the top? is that an overflow drain? can a garden house be hooked up to it?
qa_pair.answer: Hi Richard. That knob is an overflow drain but there is no way to attach a hose.

qa_pair.question: the little black knob on the top? is that an overflow drain? can a garden house be hooked up to it?
qa_pair.answer: Hi, Richard. I looked at mine, and figure the black nob at the top in the front is an overflow. I am not sure that a garden hose would do much good there. I attached a spigot to the front near the bottom. That works great for attaching a hose or filling a watering can.

qa_pair.question: the little black knob on the top? is that an overflow drain? can a garden house be hooked up to it?
qa_pair.answer: There is an over flow drain, do not buy this barrel. It is so hard to drain, do not buy if you have cold weather. My wood barrels that finally gave out over a 15 yr period of time, used to hold water and freeze in the winter time, then in spring would thaw, they continued to work well. This barrel is plastic and warps in the winter.  It might fair better in a warm area but still hard to drain or attach a hose to the drain spout at the bottom. It needs to be elevated off of the ground to comfortably get a hose attached to it.

qa_pair.question: the little black knob on the top? is that an overflow drain? can a garden house be hooked up to it?
qa_pair.answer:
Richard:  Yes, the knob on the front top is the overflow drain.  It would be possible to hook up a garden hose to it if you have the right diameter fitting to muscle it in from the outside and w/o actually blocking it.  It may be possible to get a male fitting from the inside (through the top rectangular vent) but I suspect it would be hard because of the small area to work with within the knob cavity itself.  I have mine hooked up to the gutter with the Oatey 14209 Mystic Rainwater Collection System.  I actually punched a hole on the top of the barrel with a paddle drill bit to get a perfect fitting with the hose.  Good luck.

qa_pair.question: Can the top be removed for cleaning sediment from the bottom? If not, how is sediment handled?
qa_pair.answer: Hello Henry. The top cannot be removed. However there is an opening at the top which is 14 inches by 2.5 inches. This is where the drain Pipe dumps into the barrel. You can turn the barrell upside down to empty the sediment through this hole. Hope that helps.

qa_pair.question: Can the top be removed for cleaning sediment from the bottom? If not, how is sediment handled?

qa_pair.question: when the barrel is partially full is there enough pressure to attach a spray nozzle to the hose and have the water spray out adequitly?
qa_pair.answer: Not really - My barrel is about 8" above the ground and when the barrel is partially full, or even full, the pressure is adequate to fill watering cans or water nearby plants but not to actually "spray" very far as you would with an outdoor faucet. This unit works great for its intended purpose - to water our plants with "free" untreated water.

qa_pair.question: when the barrel is partially full is there enough pressure to attach a spray nozzle to the hose and have the water spray out adequitly?

qa_pair.question: What is the wats of this unit
qa_pair.answer: The power draw when plugged in is minimal, basically like any small battery charger. I don't see the exact number specified, but I'd be really surprised if it pulls more than 25 or 30 watts. The difference between the zapper and other rechargeable, battery operated appliances (like a rechargeable flashlight, for example) is that the swatter is engineered to deliver a quick, low current, 2500 volt discharge when the grid is shorted - such as when you swat a bug. It has plenty of power to fry the bug, but not enough to hurt you even if you short the grid with your fingertip.

qa_pair.question: Given the lack of a crossguard, has anyone experienced cuts from their grip slipping while gardenning?
qa_pair.answer: This is my most often used garden tool.  I've never had my hand slip ever while using this tool. qa_pair.question: What are the benefits of this cover, other than keeping the Weber clean? Is there any harm in leaving a Weber grill out in the open?
qa_pair.answer: If you clean out the ash each time you use it there's no problem. The cover helps prevent moisture from collecting in the ash and that will rust out the bottom of your smoker.

qa_pair.question: What are the benefits of this cover, other than keeping the Weber clean? Is there any harm in leaving a Weber grill out in the open?

qa_pair.question: Any recommendation on how much weight to add?  How wide is the tray to hold weight (front to back)?

qa_pair.question: Any recommendation on how much weight to add?  How wide is the tray to hold weight (front to back)?
qa_pair.answer: I used 2 standard 8" concrete blocks. I believe they are about 30 pounds each and they fit on the tray with a little extra room so the tray is probably 9" or so from front to back. There are two setting for 'depth'. The lowest setting was digging in the ground too much for me so I used the first (highest) setting. There is also a setting where the tines won't touch the ground when you are just moving from one location to another.

qa_pair.question: Any recommendation on how much weight to add?  How wide is the tray to hold weight (front to back)?
qa_pair.answer: I put two cinder blocks on mine. The large ones with the two square holes. The tray has holes for connecting bunjees. I use the black rubber ones with metal hooks. I have a polaris ranger 500 I use to pull it but I think a descent rider will pull it just fine. I use the level 2 and it does a pretty good job. The level 3 will take up the thatch and the grass as well. The level one will only get mulched grass and leaves.

qa_pair.question: Any recommendation on how much weight to add?  How wide is the tray to hold weight (front to back)?

summary: The grates of this product are cast iron. It has large spacing and is easy to have a small piece of food go through. This product doesn't have any provision for a rotisserie chicken. This unit isn't for use with natural gas and is only approved to be used with a propane attachment. The width of the grill is 28.5 inches without the side wings. With the lid down, it is 10" inside and can fit a chicken. There may be a size issue with a beer can underneath the chicken. This product comes with a drip tray that sits towards the back that will catch drippings but doesn't sit completely under the burners for all of it to be caught for clean up. It only covers about 30% of the underside of the grill. The side shelves are not collapsible and one of the sides has a side burner. The warming rack of this product is stationary and doesn't move but the grill is very well crafted.

qa_pair.question: how to set for half circle
qa_pair.answer: Just slide the metal pins near the base of the head.  There is a little piece that flips up or down.  It needs to be in the down position between the 2 sliders behind the direction of water spray.  When it is up, the spray will go in a 360 degree circle.

qa_pair.question: Is there a way to fix the sprinkler head if it just suddenly stops working? It started spewing water in a stream and stopped rotating..
qa_pair.answer: Problem shoot:Could mean that the water pressure is too lowCould mean that the sand or debris is caught - just manually rotate it a few time to rule this outCould mean that the actually sprinkler unit is bad - that part can be removed from the tripod and replaced for short moneyCould mean that one of the adjustment thingys - either the sprinker screw, the rotation springs, or the splash shield thing are impeding the spray.  Either way, don't spend much time problem shooting, the replacement head -even the good brass ones - don't cost much.

rewrite.edit: The water pressure may be too low, to fix manually rotate the sprinkler head a few times, if it doesn't work, a new head may need to be purchased. There could also be an issue with the sprinkler screw, the rotation springs, or the splash shield.

qa_pair.question: Is there a way to fix the sprinkler head if it just suddenly stops working? It started spewing water in a stream and stopped rotating..
qa_pair.answer: This happened to me and I flipped the little wire loop that pushes the flange to make the sprinkler reciprocate.  It worked and hasn't messed up again.  Also, sometime there is a little bit of debris in the nozzle and it doesn't make enough force to push the sprinkler.  You can clean it out with a  little wire Good luck!

qa_pair.question: Is there a way to fix the sprinkler head if it just suddenly stops working? It started spewing water in a stream and stopped rotating..
qa_pair.answer: Yes, the head unscrews and you can replace the head with another.  Mine was bent so I unscrewed it from the base and took a head from ground sprinkler.  But be sure nothing has been bent and the sprinkler is level.  Also, some have been manufactured with the "arm" that controls the spraying upside down.  The "arm" should be straight out and the bar that hits the water should be bent DOWN not up.  If you have the bend going up there is no way that I could figure out how to fix that.  -------\    NOT ______/

qa_pair.question: do you have to clean it every use?
qa_pair.answer: It is a good practice to triple rinse the sprayer after every use (this includes running clean water through the spray tip).  This will help prolong the life of the parts.  Dried chemicals - even organics - can dry in the sprayer and clog it start degrading the plastic and rubber parts.

qa_pair.question: Can an older couple use this machine or it to heavy?

qa_pair.question: Can an older couple use this machine or it to heavy?

qa_pair.question: Can an older couple use this machine or it to heavy?
qa_pair.answer: It can't be lifted because it's too heavy, but it is relatively easy to use. A flat driveway would probably be fine with wheels.  I'm over 60 but I'm physically fit.

qa_pair.question: Can an older couple use this machine or it to heavy?

qa_pair.question: He, would a 2000w generator be able to run this charger?
qa_pair.answer: Probably yes, as long as there were no other major loads on the generator. This unit draws a maximum of 13 amps at 120 VAC which equates to about 1560 watts, make it just over 1600 watts if you account for the charger efficiency of >93%. Obviously these numbers are based on maximum output form the charger (100 amps). You may want to consider a power conditioner in between the generator and the charger, depending on how clean the power is from your generator. If it is an inverter generator then this is not necessary. Hope this helps.

summary: The wagon handle is a single bar appropriate for one-hand use and the tires are not balloon inflatables. The product can be used on sand that is deep and fine and is useful for the beach and would also have no trouble managing on a gravel path. The assembly requires the wagon to fold into its carry bag, or you have the option to pull it if you correctly align two of the wheels for this wagon to be pulled when collapsed, though this may not be as comfortable. The cushions are not too high as they would fall over the top, but this product has just the canvas cover over the steel frame so it would not be comfortable for prolonged sitting. The product has great carrying space, and would easily carry a medium-sized dog like a Golden Retriever.

summary: This product is a fire pit table that is set up like all gas fireplaces and uses any substance that is made for fire. The base on this table is dark brown with a powder coated aluminum frame. The electric ignition switch is mounted on one of the base legs and is battery operated. The fire gets pretty hot and intense and the units are rated to be around 60,000 BTU. You could use the fire pit table to roast hot dogs but using fire gel with this gas fire pit is not advised.

qa_pair.question: how much does it weigh?
qa_pair.answer: The saw weighs about 7 lbs.  How you hold and use the saw affects the way that 7 lbs. feels to the user.  The longer you extend the handle and the closer you hold it parallel to the ground makes it seem heavier. Always position the saw and yourself so your comfortable with the weight and you should be safe.

qa_pair.question: How difficult is it to adjust the tension of the chain?
qa_pair.answer: Not at all difficult.  Use the screwdriver end of the included tool (or a regular flat screwdriver), turn one direction to tighten the chain and the other to loosen the chain.

qa_pair.question: Will this pick up mounds of settled leaves?
qa_pair.answer: Matted leaves or leaves that have been rained on or snowed on are too much for this lawn sweeper...you have to rake them and then run the sweeper over them repeatedly to get some of them up...then repeat.  Best results appear to be freshly fallen dry leaves on very short grass.  Recommend mowing on lowest setting right before leaves start to fall.

qa_pair.question: Does this pick up algae that has settled on the bottom of the pool
qa_pair.answer: Hi This is Steve at Aqua Products, This unit is indeed designed to vacuum debris including leaves, loose algae and sand. Be sure to empty the bag often. Note: Some stubborn debris that sticks to the bottom may benefit from units that Scrub or those that have Power Washing Jets - these help loosen that debris and vacuum it up more efficiently. If you would like more information please reach out to me at sferry@aquaproducts.com

qa_pair.question: Does this pick up algae that has settled on the bottom of the pool
qa_pair.answer: We've had our unit for less than 2 weeks and it's been a champ at vacuuming up algae .  We don't have issues with leaves or sand, just algae and bugs.

qa_pair.question: Does this pick up algae that has settled on the bottom of the pool
qa_pair.answer: I haven't had success with this aquabot picking up algae at all. Have run it twice with no luck. You're better off getting the pool rover jr.

qa_pair.question: Does this pick up algae that has settled on the bottom of the pool
qa_pair.answer: Yes it does, as long as it hasn't been growing for a lobg time. I'd first treat water with algaecide, wait for algae to die and then let the Aquabiøot do its thibg. Yoou'll probably need to hose iff the 2 filter bags several times during the treatment. Good luck.

qa_pair.question: Does this pick up algae that has settled on the bottom of the pool
qa_pair.answer: Yes, it does. This is the main reason I chose it. You may see it fluff up the algae but after the 2hr cycle around and around the pool it is diamond clear. Rinse the fine filtering bags after every use with a garden hose. My formula for algae success is shock with chlorine powder AND use swamp treat or yellow out plus a.clarifier while running pump 24/7.  This works within days and the algae at the bottom is gone with rover the vacuum. I use it daily, every day and would not be without one. By far the best purchase I made.

qa_pair.question: Does this pick up algae that has settled on the bottom of the pool
qa_pair.answer: Definitely not live algae.  This has no brushes and algae tends to stick a bit even when it's been killed.  Even my more expensive Aquabot with brushes has a tough time with algae.  As I said in my review this is best used for large and/or loose debris.

qa_pair.question: Does it go around full stairs(3-feet deep) that are installed in the pool?
qa_pair.answer: Hello, No cleaner will climb the stairs, but it will climb the walls and the floor.

qa_pair.question: Does it go around full stairs(3-feet deep) that are installed in the pool?
qa_pair.answer: No. It operates along a back and forth path. Areas around stays will eventually be covered.

qa_pair.question: Does it go around full stairs(3-feet deep) that are installed in the pool?
qa_pair.answer: We have three stairs in our pool. The robot stays on the flat bottom of the pool. It does not go up the stairs. I brush off the stairs before putting the robot to work and that seems to be OK.

qa_pair.question: rate this blower from 1 to 10 to clean on grass,thanks
qa_pair.answer: Depends on what you mean, "on grass": to clean grass clippings off pavement or packed earth, 10; to blow leaves off an ordinary three- or four-inch lawn, 7. HTH.

rewrite.edit: to clean grass clippings off pavement, clean on grass,thanks
To clean grass clippings off of pavement this blower is a 10 out of 10. To blow leaves off a lawn, it's a 7 out of 10.

qa_pair.question: rate this blower from 1 to 10 to clean on grass,thanks
qa_pair.answer: Is a 5 on 10.  Not powerful enough to blow leaves off grass.  I use it for drive-way, patio and between plants.

qa_pair.question: rate this blower from 1 to 10 to clean on grass,thanks
qa_pair.answer: If you are talking about piles of grass on grass, it is not that powerful.  Light leaves on grass might work for you, although I have only used it for this once with very light leaves.  I find this very satisfactory for blowing grass and dirt on hard surfaces.  I wouldn't expect this to be satisfactory for clearing things off lawns.  t use the 24 volt version.  Higher voltage may give you more power.  I just didn't need that.

qa_pair.question: rate this blower from 1 to 10 to clean on grass,thanks
qa_pair.answer: Part of it depends on how high the grass is.  If the leaves are stuck in the grass, it takes the right angle of the blower to make them move.  If the leaves are sitting on top of the grass, I'd say about 8.  Part of it also depends on how heavy the leaves are (if they're wet.)  That's the hardest to make them move, and then it'd be about a 5.

qa_pair.question: what is the country of origin on this product?
qa_pair.answer: Fiskars is a Finnish company and the product was planned and developed in Finland, but like in so many cases today it is a "Made in China" product. The quality is however good and PowerGear is a perfect help in garden when you're doing bigger branches and bushes.

qa_pair.question: what is the country of origin on this product?
qa_pair.answer:
The label on my Fiskars lopper says "made in China," but I would not discount the quality of this product because of that.  As with all manufactured products regardless of where they are made, the quality of the end product is a result of the design specifications, the materials used, the manufacturing specifications, the inspection processes throughout, and the final quality assurance inspections.  The product I have is not made cheaply and has a lifelong warranty, made for Fiskars Brands, a company located in Madison, WI.  The Fiskars corporate headquarters are located in Helsinki, Finland, where they originated in 1649.

qa_pair.question: Can these be used in a smoker box made for a gas grill?
qa_pair.answer: You cannot use any water to soak a wood pellet as it will turn to wet saw dust, and the dry pellets would probably burn too quickly in a gas grill smoker box. I always used wood chips in my smoker box.

qa_pair.question: Can these be used in a smoker box made for a gas grill?

qa_pair.question: Can these be used in a smoker box made for a gas grill?
qa_pair.answer: Yes they can. I've used pellets to add smoke when using gas grills for a long time; although I haven't used this brand. I use BBQ Delight, and they use to sell a smoker kit for gas grills. Just fill your smoker box, and the best location is under the grate close to the flames. They should also work on top of the grates, though not as well, and it will take additional time for them to start smoking. As mentioned in an earlier reply, don't soak them.

qa_pair.question: Will it work with stink bugs?
qa_pair.answer: Yes, it works on most everything including wasps, small spiders, and even most beetles.

qa_pair.question: Will it work with stink bugs?
qa_pair.answer: This tool is sooooo cool.  Yes, it will suck up stink bugs.  It grabs little tiny spiders and big spiders and anything creepy and crawly.  It actually makes sucking up the bugs fun!  My oldest daughter asked us to get 2 more so we could have one on every floor.

qa_pair.question: Will it work with stink bugs?
qa_pair.answer: It works great with stink bugs. That is why we got it. We keep one upstairs, downstairs & at work. Works great with spiders too. My son said it "makes catching bugs a sport".

qa_pair.question: Will it work with stink bugs?
qa_pair.answer: Never tried it but unless they are holding on very tenaciously it should work.  Don't know whether the stink will be a problem.

qa_pair.question: Will it work with stink bugs?
qa_pair.answer: It's perfect for stink bugs.  Our Bugzooka came with a spare bug-catching compartment, and it does help to wash one out when you empty it.  We found after using it all last fall and winter that we have a lot fewer stink bugs this year, too.  And there's something really satisfying about stalking and catching them.  Ours are too dumb to fly away even when we put the thing right next to them to suck them up.

qa_pair.answer: Not unless they are ontop of each other. It uses a short burst of vacuumed air from compressing the chamber. One bug at a time and ideally ones which are not moving as the top is small and narrow. You won't be emptying out a bee hive with it.

qa_pair.question: Can it pick up multiple bugs at a time?

qa_pair.question: Does it pick up roaches?
qa_pair.answer: Yes, actually it does. The suction is quite strong, more than enough for large roaches. It is unfortunate that they get injured this way because they are so large, but since they are headed for extermination at my house anyway, I am just grateful to have the long tube between me and the bug.

It is more made for beetles, small bees, small spiders, stinkbugs, etc. Any bug longer or larger than the diameter of the circle that sucks the bugs in will be damaged by the forceful suction. qa_pair.answer: The BugZooka is absolutely unbeatable when it comes to catching stinkbugs, ladybugs, flies, spiders, crickets, etc. It works so well that we have have two BugZookas, one on the top floor and one  the main floor of our house. qa_pair.question: What is this refined from? How is it refined? Also, does this require 15x less for the same amount of available Phosphates as 0-3-0 Pock Phosphate?
qa_pair.answer: Gardening is hit n miss.  WHY do you think you need Phosphate???  If you have consulted your local nursery n they told you to use Triple phosphate THEY should know.  The ultimate answer is in the results of actually using the phosphate to see what your plants need.  THAT IS HOW GARDENING WORKS....TREAT A SMALL AREA N SEE WHAT RESULTS YOU GET.  GARDENING IS TRIAL N ERROR.  WHAT WORKS IN ONE GARDEN MAY NOT WORK IN 100 OTHER GARDENS WORLDWIDE.  GARDENS ARE INDIVIDUAL SO JUST DO IT.

rewrite.edit: While there isn't any information about where this is refined from, if the local nursery gave advice to use phosphate for gardening, it would be recommended to follow that advice. Gardening is trail and error, what may work in some gardens won't work in others.

This product can be hit and miss with gardening. Try treating a small area to see how well it works. Gardening is trial and error so it is impossible to guess how exactly well the product will work. Gardening is an individual experience, so there will always be some hits and misses.

This is refined form of triple phosphate. This will be needed for plant growth. Triple phosphate is refined into phosphate by local methods. Converted into 15x or less for the same amount of available phosphate as 0-3-0 pock phosphate.

qa_pair.question: can i mix it with 10-0-10 granular fertlizer and at what ratios?
qa_pair.answer: Depends on the ration you want.  One to one give you 5-23-5 if you keep the spread rate the same.  I use it plain on flowering plants and vegetable with seeming success.  I then mix with a high nitrogen to get the rest of the yard.  The math is simple - 3-1 gives you 30-46-30, but you have to put out four times as much or same spread rate divide everything by 4 (7.5-11.5-7.5.  Side comment - push the nitrogen if you are expecting company as it is what greens the yard.

This is in the form of pellets that are 2x the size of apple seeds and takes some time to dissolve. The fertilizer is a refined form of triple phosphate needed for plant growth. This product is made from the USA, A.H. Hoffman, Lancaster and works great with the recommended amount for super awesome root structure.

qa_pair.question: Does the on switch lock or do you have to hold it and if so, is it comfortable?
qa_pair.answer: There is a sliding switch you have to push at the same time as you squeeze the handle.  Once the power is engaged you can release the sliding switch and the trimmer will run as long as you continue to squeeze the handle.  I couldn't remember so I went outside to use it.  I'm currently having painful arthritis flare up so nothing is comfortable.  However, it wasn't too bad.  The tasks I have  are not too great, so I wouldn't be using it for long durations of time anyway.  The trimmer isn't very heavy so that helps too. qa_pair.question: Does the on switch lock or do you have to hold it and if so, is it comfortable?
qa_pair.answer: Yes, I have to hold it, and even though I have pretty severe arthritis, it's not difficult to hold.  I also like the fact that for safety reasons that it will shut off if I release it!!

qa_pair.question: Does the on switch lock or do you have to hold it and if so, is it comfortable?
qa_pair.answer: You have to hold it.  Safety feature.  So when you let go it turns off.  I have arthritis & it was okay for me.  I had to stand in bed of my truck & hold it over my head to cut the tall thick shrubs.  I was very happy with it.

qa_pair.question: Does the on switch lock or do you have to hold it and if so, is it comfortable?
qa_pair.answer: This Black and Decker model does NOT have an "on" lock.   It works great for those smaller projects.   I would not recommend it for an "overhead" job.    It would not be comfortable if you had to trim a hedge or greenery higher than your shoulders because the ON switch does not have a LOCK button,   It is great and comfortable for those smaller jobs, such as below the waste.   I use mine on a small hedge that is only 18 to 20 inches high.

qa_pair.question: Does the on switch lock or do you have to hold it and if so, is it comfortable?
qa_pair.answer: There are two steps to turning on the motor.  You must flip a switch on top of the handle and then while operating, squeeze the handle. When you stop squeezing the handle, the motor will stop. It is not hard to use, nor uncomfortable.  I do need to switch hands from time to time, but it isn't too heavy.  You do need to be careful when you don't want to cut, to not squeeze the handle.  Hope that helps!

qa_pair.question: Does the on switch lock or do you have to hold it and if so, is it comfortable?
qa_pair.answer: Once the blade starts up, it locks on and runs without holding the button.

qa_pair.question: What is the width and thickness of the blade?
qa_pair.answer: The bar consists of three parts seated flat against each other; a supporting piece of channel iron 5/8 x 5/16", and two flat pieces of steel that slide back and forth over each other to cut like a barbers shears. qa_pair.question: What are the dimensions of the fire pit? And any good ideas on how to keep the rain out to prevent rust in the bowl?

qa_pair.question: What are the dimensions of the fire pit? And any good ideas on how to keep the rain out to prevent rust in the bowl?
qa_pair.answer: In looking at the bowl there are a couple of small holes for water drainage.   The dimensions are 55" from point to point and about 21 inches high.  16 to 18 inches from the bowl to the edge of the table.  Excellent table top and seems to be very durable for all kinds of weather.

qa_pair.question: What are the dimensions of the fire pit? And any good ideas on how to keep the rain out to prevent rust in the bowl?
qa_pair.answer: We use a 21 inch metal trash can lid.  Our porch is open, exposed and often very windy.  We keep the lid on with a couple of bungee cords.  The vinyl cover that came with it didn't make it through the first good storm.  Not the prettiest option, but it works well for us.

summary: This product throws enough heat at 45 degrees to radiate enough heat on a chilly fall night. Some glass rocks will really help bring out the size of the flame. The tank has a pull-out tray that is under the mantel and there are drainage holes already in the pan. The lattice-work base is black and includes a black cloth cover for the LP  that disappears. The LP tank will plumb into a natural gas line. The dimensions of GAD1374SP are L55.1 x W47.6 x H22.4  which include a cover.
